intro: Didymocheton glomeratus, commonly known as the clustered screwpod, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, clustered inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often grouped in dense clusters, giving it its common name. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Didymocheton glomeratus is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
